all_procs.procedure_1.csv:
item,phasetype,survey,max_time,text,notes,shuffle_1,shuffle_2,task_title,task_body_text,weight, 0,afw_intro,,user,Welcome,no_mobile,off,off,,,, 0,tde_survey,afw_demo.csv,user,,,,,,,, 0,afw_caffeine,,user,,,,,,,, 0,afw_sleep,,user,,,,,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Breakout,,,,Breakout Instructions,"Thank you for answering those questions.

The first game is Breakout, which will be displayed on the next screen.

You will see a box in the centre of the screen that forms the playing area. At the bottom of the box, you will see a ball attached to a paddle. At the top of the box, you will see rows of blocks. Press the spacebar to release the ball towards the blocks and start the game. The ball will travel up the box and bounce off the blocks, destroying them, heading back towards the paddle. Use the left and right arrow keys, move the paddle so that the ball bounces off it back towards the blocks. Depending on where the ball lands on the paddle, the angle that it bounces off changes. For example, landing on the left side will bounce the ball up diagonally to the left. If the ball passes the paddle, and hits the bottom of the box, you lose a life.

You score points for each block that you break and the aim of the game is to gain as many points as possible. Your total points (and lives) are displayed at the top of the box. When all 3 lives are lost, the game restarts with points reverting to 0, so you can have another attempt.

This game lasts 3 minutes. The timer is visible underneath the game and the bar empties to reflect the time remaining. When the bar turns red, this indicates that there is very limited time remaining. The timer will continue going down even if the game restarts. Once the timer runs out the game will end, and you will automatically be taken to the next screen.

The highest scores of the research team are: Aaliyah: 8300, Chris: 7000, Phil: 6700

To start the game, please press the blue start button below. Try to see how many points you can get without losing all your lives! Good luck and have fun!",, 0,breakout,,180,,,,,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Questionnaires,,,,Post-game measures,"Thank you for playing the Breakout.

Please complete the following two questionnaires regarding your frustration and attention while playing Breakout.

When you are ready, please start 'Start Questionnaires' below",, 0,tde_survey,post-task_attention_scale.csv,user,,,q1,,,,, 0,tde_survey,state_frustration_scale.csv,user,,,q1,,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Word Search,,,ws1,Word Search Instructions,"Thank you for completing the questionnaires.

The next game is a word search, which will be displayed on the next screen.

On the next screen, a grid of letters will appear. There are 10 familiar words about household items that you would have encountered before, hidden in the word search. Words can appear horizontally, vertically or diagonally and are displayed as a list on the right of the grid.

When you think you’ve found a word in the grid, click and drag over the letters using the mouse to create a yellow line. If the selected letters are correct, the line will turn green, and the word is removed from the list on the right of the grid. If the letters selected are not correct, the line will turn red and disappear. At the top of the screen, the number of words found is displayed.

The aim is to find all 10 words within 5 minutes. The timer is displayed in the same way as in Breakout, as a bar underneath the letter grid. The bar empties, to reveal the amount of time left. When the bar turns red, this indicates that there is very little time left. Once the timer runs out, the task will end, and your score will be displayed.

If you have located less than half the words by when the countdown timer reaches halfway, a hint button will button will appear under the list of words to find. When pressed, this will put a square around an area of the grid where a word is located. After a few seconds, this square will disappear. You only get 1 hint.

To start the wordsearch, please click the blue start button below. Good luck and have fun!",, 0,afw_wordsearch,,300,"'Chair,Table,Spoon,Plate,Towel,Soap,Brush,Light,Clock,Pillow'",,,ws1,,,, 0,afw_ws_feedback,,user,Start Questionnaires,,,,Post-game measures,"Thank you for completing the word search.

Unfortunately, you only managed to find X out of 10 words. Please complete these questionnaires regarding the level of frustration and attention you felt towards the word search.",, 0,tde_survey,post-task_attention_scale.csv,user,,,q2,,,,, 0,tde_survey,state_frustration_scale.csv,user,,,q2,,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Tetris,,,,Tetris Instructions,"Thank you for completing the questionnaires.

The next game is Tetris. In the centre of the screen you will see a box, Different shaped blocks will fall from the top of the box. You can rotate the falling block using the up-arrow key or moved it horizontally using the left and right arrow keys. If you wish to increase the speed the block falls at, press the down-arrow key. The aim of Tetris is to gain as many points as possible, by organising the falling blocks so that they complete a row. Completing rows will increase your score and for every 1000 points scored, the speed that the blocks fall will increase. Completed rows will disappear, providing more space to organise the shapes.

On the right side of the game area, your score will be displayed along with the next shape that is going to fall. To pause the game, press the letter ‘P’ on the keyboard, however, this will not pause the timer. It just stops the shapes from falling.

This game will last for 3 minutes. The timer is displayed in the same way as in the previous games, with a bar underneath the game box. As the bar empties, this indicates that the time left is decreasing. When the bar turns red, this indicates that there is very little time left. Once the timer runs out, the task will end, and you will automatically be taken to the next screen.

The highest scores of the research team are: Aaliyah: 3800, Chris: 4200, Phil: 3700.

To start playing Tetris, please press the blue start button below. Good luck and have fun getting as many points as you can!",, 0,tetris,,180,,seconds,,,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Questionnaires,,,,Post-game measures,Thank you for playing the Tetris.

Please complete the following two questionnaires regarding your frustration and attention while playing Tetris.,, 0,tde_survey,post-task_attention_scale.csv,user,,,q3,,,,, 0,tde_survey,state_frustration_scale.csv,user,,,q3,,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Word Search,,,ws2,Word Search Instructions,"Thank you for completing the questionnaires.

The next game is a word search, which will be displayed on the next screen.

On the next screen, a grid of letters will appear. There are 10 medical terms words you are likely to unfamiliar with, hidden in the word search. Words can appear horizontally, vertically or diagonally and are displayed as a list on the right of the grid.

When you think you’ve found a word in the grid, click and drag over the letters using the mouse to create a yellow line. If the selected letters are correct, the line will turn green, and the word is removed from the list on the right of the grid. If the letters selected are not correct, the line will turn red and disappear. At the top of the screen, the number of words found is displayed.

The aim is to find all 10 words within 5 minutes. The timer is displayed in the same way as in Breakout, as a bar underneath the letter grid. The bar empties, to reveal the amount of time left. When the bar turns red, this indicates that there is very little time left. Once the timer runs out, the task will end, and your score will be displayed.

If you have located less than half the words by when the countdown timer reaches halfway, a hint button will button will appear under the list of words to find. When pressed, this will put a square around an area of the grid where a word is located. After a few seconds, this square will disappear. You only get 1 hint.

To start the wordsearch, please click the blue start button below. Good luck and have fun!",, 0,afw_wordsearch,,300,"'Dorsal,Alveoli,Scapula,Suture,Dyspnea,Pyrexia,Hallux,Keloid,Trachea,Thymus,Anemia,Biopsy,Fibroid'",,,ws2,,,, 0,afw_ws_feedback,,user,Start Questionnaires,,,,Post-game measures,"Thank you for completing the word search.

Unfortunately, you only managed to find X out of 10 words. Please complete these questionnaires regarding the level of frustration and attention you felt towards the word search.",, 0,tde_survey,post-task_attention_scale.csv,user,,,q4,,,,, 0,tde_survey,state_frustration_scale.csv,user,,,q4,,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Debrief,,,,End of Experimental Tasks,"Thank you for completing the final set of questionnaires.

You have now finished all the experimental tasks, puzzles, and games within the study. We hope you enjoyed it.

We now need to debrief you. This is a three step process. When you are ready to start, please click the button below.",, 0,afw_youtube,,user,"""uqj7f4M8iTw""",,,,Step 1: Kittens & Puppies,"The first step of the debrief requires you to watch a 2 minute video of kittens and puppies. This is being included to mitigate any frustration you may be feeling after playing the puzzles and games as a pilot test revealed people became frustrated if they did not do as well as they thought thought they might.

This video has sound, so please use the headphones provided. There are brand new. To start the video simply click on it. Once it has finished playing, it will be replaced by a button allowing you to continue to the next stage of the debrief.",, 0,afw_youtube,,user,"""QLb5sAXtQHU""",,,,Step 2: Message From Chris Dobson,"The second step of your debrief requires you to watch a 4 minute video of Chris Dobson, senior researcher on the project, explaining the study aims.

Once again, this video has sound, so please use the headphones provided. To start the video simply click on it. Once it has finished playing, it will be replaced by a button allowing you to continue to the final stage of the debrief.",, 0,afw_end,,user,,,,,,,,

afw_demo.csv:
Demographic Information



Please could you help us better understand the diversity and inclusivity of our participants (and thus how well our data is applicable to the general population) by completing the questions below.

Questions 1-5 are optional, you do not have to answer if you wish (please select "Prefer not to say", if that is the case).

1. Please enter your age (in years)
(the input only accepts numbers e.g., 21)
Man|Woman|Non-Binary|Trans|In a way not listed|Prefer not to say
4. What is the highest level of education you have completed?
GCSEs or equivalent|A-Levels or equivalent|Undergraduate (e.g., BSc)|Postgraduate (e.g., MSc)|Doctoral degree|Other|Prefer not to say

5. What is your current employment status?
(if you are a student, working outside your studies, please choose 'Student')
post-task_attention_scale.csv:
Post Task Attention Scale



INSTRUCTIONS:
Read each statement below and select the appropriate response to indicate how much you agree or disagree with it in relation to your experience while completing the previous task. There are no right or wrong answers. Do not spend too much time on any one statement but give the answer which seems to describe your present feelings best.
I was fully focused on the puzzle/game from start to finish.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I felt my thoughts drift away from the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I often caught myself thinking about unrelated matters.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I felt actively engaged with what I was doing.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I was easily distracted during the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I gave the puzzle/game my full attention throughout.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I found it hard to concentrate on the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I was aware of what my actions throughout the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
Time seemed to pass quickly because I was absorbed in the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
state_frustration_scale.csv:
State Frustration Scale



INSTRUCTIONS:
Read each statement below and select the appropriate response to indicate how much you agree or disagree with it in relation to your experience while completing the previous task. There are no right or wrong answers. Do not spend too much time on any one statement but give the answer which seems to describe your present feelings best.
I felt frustrated while completing the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I felt annoyed by the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I wanted to quit the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I felt irritated with my progress.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
The puzzle/game stopped me from doing what I wanted.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I felt physically tense as while playing the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I kept thinking the puzzle/game was unfair.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I kept any frustration I felt inside me while completing the puzzle/game.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
I kept thinking the puzzle/game didn’t make sense.
Strongly Disagree|Disagree|Slightly Disagree|Neither Agree Nor Disagree|Slightly Agree|Agree|Strongly Agree
